node.title: 'They have him': Tim Gunn's quarantine escape and capture seen through government emails
node.description: Email exchanges obtained by the ABC show Tasmania's governmental agencies trying to work out how Tim Gunn was able to flee hotel quarantine, with news of him being taken back into custody communicated in a one-line email as "they have him".
node.content:
["Email exchanges in the days after Tim Gunn's escape from COVID quarantine, which threw southern Tasmania into a snap lockdown in October, show Tasmania's governmental agencies trying to work out how he did it \u2014 and who was to blame.", "Documents obtained by the ABC under Right To Information legislation have been widely redacted,\u00a0but show correspondence between staff at the Travelodge, where Gunn had been taken to after arriving in Hobart from New South Wales, the security company at the hotel, the Communities Department, the Tasmanian Health Service and others, following the breach.", "The emails also reveal in the days after Gunn's escape, agencies were discussing that it represented an \"opportunity\" to drive home the message that the escape was \"an outlier and generally the program has been watertight\".", "Gunn has since pleaded guilty to\u00a0lying to authorities and leaving quarantine without permission\u00a0with his\u00a0lawyer telling the court he had left via an \"emergency exit\" \u2014 however, back in October, authorities mulled over several possibilities for days after the incident, which led the government to declare a 72-hour lock down which ranged across southern Tasmania.", "", "
Security was increased in the wake of Gunn's escape from the Travelodge Hotel.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "Gunn's absconding from Hobart's Travelodge on October 11 \u2014\u00a0and his eventual return by Tasmania Police after he spent around 18 hours in the community while\u00a0COVID-positive \u2014\u00a0is the subject of a number or incident reports by the government liaison officer (GLO) at the hotel and Kevlar Security Solutions (KSS).", "On Tuesday, October 12, the day after Gunn\u00a0bolted, the GLO at the hotel wrote\u00a0to \"seek advice\" about\u00a0what to do.", "\"The manager and security knocked and announced that they were opening the door. Once inside they did not find the guest. They searched the room then looked for identification in a bag that was left in the room,\" the email read.", "In this, one of the first emails following the incident, the GLO seemed\u00a0to suspect a gap in security was to blame.", "\"Question for me is, if security was on the floor at all times, how did the guest exit the hotel?\" the email read.", "\"Also, if the security was observant then they should have let the hotel manager know that the meals were not taken into the room by the guest.\"", "", "
Gunn told\u00a0the\u00a0driver of the bus taking him to the Travelodge he was not happy about going into quarantine.(Facebook: Tim Gunn)
", "
'They have him'
", "The Emergency Commander at Tasmania's Communities Department wrote\u00a0at 4.10pm that Gunn \"had previously been refused entry to Tasmania and had been told not to enter Tasmania\".", "\"He was directed to quarantine at the Travelodge Hobart ... he did not complete his phone check-in with hotel reception last night.\"", "The email added, \"it is likely he left his room last night possibly via the fire escape\".", "Ten minutes later, a manager at KSS wrote\u00a0\"I have not been able to confirm how this has occurred\".", "At 4.44pm, an email from the Emergency Commander arrived\u00a0with the subject line:\u00a0\"They have him\".", "An incident report from the Travelodge later on Tuesday noted\u00a0Gunn was\u00a0returned to the hotel by police, with \"additional security to ensure compliance\".", "\"17.50 guest returned to the hotel with a police escort, and police escorted the guest to the room. Two security officers will be stationed outside the room until guest departs.\"", "That was not the end of it though:\u00a0just 20 minutes later \"security reported that the guest was banging the room door and shouting. As police were still onsite, the issue was escalated to them immediately and they went to the room to talk to the guest\".", "Authorities at that point gave in to Gunn's demand for a phone, according to the documents.", "An email from KSS noted: \"Tasmania Police would provide one permanent officer on site until guest checked out ... police officer preferred to stay in his vehicle in front parking area\".", "Questions still bounced between departments as to how the 31-year-old was able to evade security, with KSS emailing they had already had in place two extra guards placed on Level 4 \"if he again create[s]\u00a0any trouble police will be informed immediately\".", "", "
Tim Gunn escaped hotel quarantine in Hobart and was found by police in the community.(ABC News: Rob Reibel)
", "
'This message is not to alarm you'
", "Soon\u00a0after news broke of the escape, reporters were asking questions, with the government then emailing its \"hotel quarantine, security and transport partners\" to ensure \"any questions are responded to through the appropriate clearance chains and in a standardised way\".", "\"This message is not to alarm you but to notify you there will be public and media interest.\u00a0If you are contacted please direct them to Communities Tasmania media manager.\"", "A manager at KSS advised\u00a0the government they had\u00a0been contacted by a journalist and that they \"politely declined to comment and referred her to Dept of Communities\", as they had been instructed.", "Another email from a redacted source apologised\u00a0\u2014 \"sorry to keep bombarding you with requests\" \u2014\u00a0before asking for information from the hotel to help \"refute any claim Gunn was granted permission to leave the hotel\" by the government liaison officer, apparently in a conversation with police.", "\"The body-worn camera footage shows that Mr Gunn was told the GLO at the hotel may make arrangements for him to go to another address in the next day or two\", the email stated.", "
Four minutes blows out to 20
", "A manager at KSS emailed\u00a0they had\u00a0\"as instructed\"\u00a0by government \"completed a review of the security procedures and the guard positions at the Travelodge Hobart\", stating \"I have not found any dereliction of duty by these officers on the night in question\".", "\"There was one gap in the compliance monitoring I can find, it was during the check in.\"", "The KSS email then pointed\u00a0out security staff having\u00a0to change their PPE in a hotel room meant\u00a0a \"four\u00a0to five\u00a0minutes\" lapse in the monitoring of the hotel's corridors.", "The KSS email said\u00a0\"actions taken to rectify these gaps\" included\u00a0the number of guards increased from \"6 to 11, accordingly if a guard needs to be involved in a check in or needs to doff and don PPE a second guard will provide continuous monitoring on each active floor\".", "By Friday, four days after Gunn's escape and eventual return to the hotel, the \"gap\" of four to five minutes which may have allowed Gun to flee had blown out.", "In the \"most likely scenario\", according to the Emergency Commander, Gunn \"probably took the opportunity to leave the building via the fire escape which was not covered by CCTV in the 10- to 20-minute window given by the security guard requiring to don and doff PPE\".", "Seven pages covering minutes from an internal government briefing were\u00a0redacted.", "The author of one email, anonymous after being redacted, appeared to sum\u00a0it up in their correspondence late on the\u00a0night of Gunn's escape.", "\"It's been a challenging day\".", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
